items.about:
Steven is a passionate technology leader with a track record of inspiring, encouraging, and igniting momentum. Featured speaker, author, and industry thought-leader, Steven has a strong track-record of helping organizations build a vision and execute transformation. His deep technical knowledge  coupled with business insight and experience drives impactful change for organizations. 

Mathematician turned entrepreneur, Steven successfully co-founded and exited two Microsoft partner companies, both focused on building great processes and driving organizational change through culture, technology, and teamwork. 

Specialists: Artificial Intelligence, DevOps, Lean and Agile Methodology, Organizational Transformation.
items.tagline: Innovative executive with a track record of successfully incubating and launching software products.

experience.hq_location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada, North America

experience.title: Senior Director, Health Data and AI
experience.description: As Senior Director of Medical Imaging I was responsible for moving the newly incubated Azure Health Data Services DICOM service from Microsoft Research into Microsoft's commercial business. After the launch of the DICOM service preview, we had proven sufficient commercial viability and product-market fit to move from an Microsoft Research incubation project to a full-fledged Azure service. Post-launch the product is used by hospitals, medical imaging viewers and researchers across the globe. Additionally, when Nuance was acquired by Microsoft, the DICOM service (and related FHIR service) was selected to underlie the Nuance next generation data backbone, unifying the data store for all Nuance products.
experience.hq_location: Redmond, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Director, Health Cloud and Data, AI and Research
experience.description:
As Director of Medical Imaging I was responsible for the creation of the DICOM service, a petabyte-scale Azure service for cloud based medical imaging storage and analytics. As the first employee for the product, I was tasked with creating the business plan, justifying the Microsoft investment, hiring both the engineering and product management teams, and ensuring product-market fit. My team and I were one of several Healthcare incubations inside of Microsoft Research.

Within 4 months, our team had launched the Medical Imaging Server for DICOM, an open source DICOM service with code hosted on GitHub. That provided needed customers (who deployed our service on Azure), as well as a substantial amount of product and market feedback. This feedback was integrated into an Azure hosted DICOM service that launched in Preview several months later.
experience.hq_location: Redmond, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Principal Group Program Manager, Azure Boards and Reporting
experience.description:
I work with a solid team of product owners, designers and engineers to deliver Azure Boards, one of the most flexible and powerful work tracking tools in the agile development space; and Azure DevOps Reporting, the end-to-end reporting solution that powers insights into a teams software delivery.
As a Principal Group Program Manager, I was responsible for two distinct products in the Azure DevOps family of tools, both will millions of active users. I worked with a solid team of product owners, designers and engineers to deliver Azure Boards, one of the most flexible and powerful work tracking tools in the agile development space; and Azure DevOps Reporting, the end-to-end reporting solution that powers insights into a teamâ€™s software delivery.

During the Microsoft acquisition of GitHub, most teams were partially or fully integrated into GitHub. However, my team was recognized for their innovative culture and was given responsibility to incubate new products in the developer ecosystem.
experience.hq_location: Redmond, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: IoT Advisory Board Member
experience.description: I work with the IoT Advisory board as an industry member providing advice and direction on IoT-related technology and industry trends. In addition, I support our internal IoT development projects, which resulted in a 2018 IoT Innovators award. (See link associated with this role.)
experience.hq_location: Westborough, Massachusetts, United States, North America

experience.title: VP of Innovation
experience.description: As the VP of Innovation I was responsible for the digital transformation inside of 10th Magnitude, strategic technical direction and improving our data intelligence practice. Additionally, I consulted with a few key, strategic enterprise customers on their digital transformation, big data, AI/ML and DevOps efforts.
experience.hq_location: Chicago, Illinois, United States, North America

experience.title: DevOps MVP
experience.description:
I was one of the 5 initial Team System MVPs when the TFS product was officially launched in 2005. I remained an active MVP for 13 years, as the product evolved through Team Foundation System, Visual Studio Online, Visual Studio Team Services, and finally Azure DevOps. Additionally, I helped shepherd the associated community as its focus shifted from Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) to DevOps.

These were some exceptional years, and I'm certainly proud to have been entrusted by Microsoft to assist in the evolution of their product, and provide enthusiastic technical and strategic support to the overall community. I left the MVP community when I joined Microsoft as a full time employee.
experience.hq_location: Redmond, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Co-Founder and Strategist
experience.description:
In 2015 the market began to shift to the public cloud. As Strategist, I was responsible for moving the business away from a single focus on DevOps and Lean/Agile practices to embrace cloud-native development, big data and machine learning. In 2015 we successfully pivoted the focus of the business and expanded into several new markets. In 2016 we became the first West Coast Data and AI Gold Certified Microsoft partner and rapidly became the go-to partner for data and AI.

In January 2018, Northwest Cadence was acquired by 10th Magnitude. https://www.crn.com/news/channel-programs/300097791/10th-magnitude-acquires-northwest-cadence-for-azure-related-devops-analytics-app-modernization-expertise.htm
experience.hq_location: Kirkland, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Microsoft Gold Certified Partner
experience.hq_location: Kirkland, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Co-Founder
experience.description: As the Co-Founder of Northwest Cadence, I was responsible for finding customers, creating and delivering our initial offerings, hiring, and ensuring product-market fit. After reaching profitability (3 months post founding), my role expanded to include managing a rapidly growing team. During my time at Northwest Cadence, I had the privilege to work on several innovation initiatives at top companies in a variety of different industries, including Nordstrom, Quicken Loans, Mayo Clinic, Boeing and many others. One particularly interesting engagement was working with David Anderson on the very first Kanban implementation at Corbis.
experience.hq_location: Kirkland, Washington, United States, North America

experience.title: Co-Founder
experience.description:
As Co-Founder of Accentient, I spearheaded the SharePoint and .NET practices, and oversaw our training practice around several key Microsoft technologies. In 2004, my co-founder and I were exposed to Team Foundation Server (TFS) prior to its initial release. We both felt strongly that the capabilities of TFS would revolutionize software development and ease the introduction of agile development practices. We decided to pivot the company to focus exclusively on TFS and agile software delivery practices. 
After 6 successful years focusing exclusively on Microsoft's ALM tools and agile practices, I sold my portion of the company to my co-founder (Richard Hundhausen). This allowed me to found Northwest Cadence which had a stronger focus on product innovation, lean and agile development principles, and DevOps.

experience.title: Mathematician | Operations Research Analyst
experience.description: As a US government civilian mathematician attached to the US military, I provided support to both classified and unclassified military missions. My specialties involved applying machine learning and agent based tools to logistics, combat simulation, and other domains, as required. I leveraged everything from traditional tools (such as regression, clustering, support vector machines) to non-traditional machine learning tools (such as genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, neural networks, ant colony optimization).

education.description: Completed all courses related to a Master's degree in Management Information Systems while I was a member of the US military. Left the military prior to completing the final knowledge interview.

items.about:
As VP of Strategy & Product at Adobe, I lead Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Commerce, Brand Concierge, and LLM Optimizer. These products help enterprises deliver digital experiences that are both personal and measurable at scale. My focus: helping enterprises navigate transformation, from human-mediated to AI-mediated experiences.

I hold a Master's in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford and am pursuing a Master's in Psychology at Harvard, where my research explores 'orphan values'â€”a term I coined to describe personally important values that become disconnected during life transitions. The central question: what happens when the values that matter most have no home in our current roles?

Beyond Adobe, I co-founded Stark Insider and create through Atelier Stark, where my art in painting, sculpture, and writing examines identity and transformation. 

This multidisciplinary lens shapes how I approach the intersection of human and artificial intelligence.
items.tagline: VP, Strategy & Product at Adobe | Leading enterprise AI & experience innovations (AEM, Commerce, Brand Concierge, LLM Optimizer) | Creative practice at Atelier Stark
items.location: San Jose, California, United States, North America

experience.title: Vice President of Strategy and Product, Adobe Experience Cloud
experience.description:
Head of global strategy and product for Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Commerce, Adobe Brand Concierge, and Adobe LLM Optimizer. These enterprise applications redefine how brands deliver experiences that feel personal, performant, and aligned with brand intent at scale.

Under her leadership, the teams build category-defining products that help enterprises accelerate growth, drive differentiation, and stay visible and relevant in an ever-evolving, AI-powered digital landscape.
experience.hq_location: San Jose, California, United States, North America

experience.title: Senior Director, Strategy & Product Marketing, Adobe Experience Manager and Commerce
experience.description:
Sep 2019 - May 2020: Head of worldwide strategy & product marketing for Adobe Experience Manager and Adobe Commerce Cloud, focusing on strategic initiatives and market expansion.

Sep 2007 - Sep 2019: Led global strategy & product marketing for Adobe Experience Manager and Adobe Target, driving innovation in digital experiences. Enhanced personalization and adaptive solutions, establishing these products as key elements of Adobe Experience Cloud.

experience.title: Artist
experience.description:
Atelier Stark is the creative studio of Loni Stark, where painting, sculpture, and writing converge to explore the pressures and contradictions of identity, ambition, and becoming. Her work blends surreal imagery with precise structure, revealing the internal forces...emotional, intellectual, instinctual...that shape what we show the world and what we hide.

â€œEach piece is a rebellion against the lastâ€”a refusal to be defined, a challenge to what I once believed.â€ â€” Loni Stark, 2022

Follow on Instagram: @lonistark
Explore more: www.AtelierStark.com

experience.title: Co-Founder
experience.description:
Stark Insider is an independent media platform that explores original stories at the intersection of technology, art, and culture, examining how AI and human creativity shape the way we tell them.

What began as a west coast digital magazine has grown into a hub for essays, video storytelling, and creative experiments that bridge digital innovation with authentic human expression. From in-depth interviews and documentaries to reflections on artistic identity in an AI-driven world, Stark Insider captures the evolving landscape of creativity and culture.

Highlights:
â€¢ 5.4M+ views on Stark Insider TV, featuring interviews, documentaries, and experimental short films.
â€¢ Website reaches 750,000+ readers annually with content spanning technology, creative process, and cultural narratives.
â€¢ Featured on Google News, with global distribution across digital news platforms.
â€¢ Official YouTube partner with 7.1K+ subscribers and a growing audience.
â€¢ Syndicated on News Republic and leading tech news apps.
â€¢ Video content distributed across YouTube, Facebook, and Vimeo.
â€¢ RSS feeds followed by leading tech, lifestyle, and creative publications.

Today, Stark Insider continues to evolve as a platform for independent authorship, blending essays, video, and AI-human collaborations to explore the future of creative identity.
experience.hq_location: San Francisco, California, United States, North America

items.about:
With over 40 years experience,  I focus on leveraging expertise in cybersecurity and business process management to drive operational efficiency and safeguard organizational assets. My role has allowed me to contribute to impactful initiatives while ensuring a secure and optimized environment for stakeholders.  

My professional journey spans diverse leadership roles, including U.S. CISO at HSBC and Senior Vice President at Citi. These roles, coupled with my commitment to fostering positive collaboration and adaptability, position me to pursue meaningful opportunities in 2026 that align with my expertise and values.
